Case reference: 2014005006.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2007, Sun Jin, her husband Joon Han, and their daughter Il Han were seen for the last time at a school in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005385.CaseDesc: The Calgary Police Service is seeking the public's assistance in locating Laura Lee Murray. She was last seen in downtown Calgary, Alberta, on June 25, 1992.

Case reference: 2015007263.CaseDesc: Nuseiba Husan was last seen in Flamborough, Ontario on November 30, 2006. Originally from Jordan, Nuseiba frequently travels home.

Case reference: 2008007698.CaseDesc: John McColl left a note at his parent's home on January 27, 1979 stating that he was travelling to Nassau, Bahamas via the United States. He is known to have visited with friends in London, Ontario at the beginning of December, 1979.  Also, he purchased an airline ticket on December 14, 1979 in San Francisco. Family had noted that Mr. McColl was depressed at the time.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Middle Finger, previous break from injury/trauma

Case reference: 2012020095.CaseDesc: On February 21, 2006, between 8:00 and 8:30 am Draper Jim was dropped off on the road by the Health Center on the Saulteaux First Nation (North of Cochin, Saskatchewan). Draper was attempting to return home to the Witchekan First Nation and has not been seen since.

Scar: Lower Lip, Left side of lower lip
Tattoo: Right Upper Arm, Ying Yang Symbol

Case reference: 2005005799.CaseDesc: October 8, 1978, the body of an unidentified man was found floating in Hamilton Bay near the Skyway Bridge. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 140-150 lbs and his length was measured at 5'4"-5'6", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He is thought to have been in the water for months to years.

Teeth: His upper right central incisor has a silicate/resin restoration.

Case reference: 2017074234.CaseDesc: On February 27, 2016 an unidentified male believed to be between the ages of 40 to 75 years old was discovered in Jayfield Park in Brampton, Ontario.

Case reference: 2009001399.CaseDesc: Calvin Vanness was last seen on March 26, 2008 at approximately 2:30 PM in the Quinte Mall parking lot in Belleville, Ontario. He last spoke to his family to make plans to meet later that day. When he failed to meet them, his family attempted to locate him, then reported him missing on March 31, 2008. His car was located on April 1, 2008 at the Highway 38 car park in Kingston, Ontario. He was known to carry large sums of money and some cannabis. Mr. Vanness has not accessed any of his bank accounts since his disappearance.

Case reference: 2014003903.CaseDesc: Anthony Kootenay walked away from the Algar Tower fire camp 73 kilometres south of Fort McMurray, Alberta on July 13, 1985 at approximately 3:00 am. In the previous days he was described by colleagues as suffering from mental health issues related to alcohol abuse. It is believed he may have attempted to hitch-hike from the area as a passing motorist spotted someone matching his description. An extensive search by land and helicopter was conducted, however Anthony was not located. Two unconfirmed sightings occurred at the Grand Hotel in Edmonton, AB on December 23, 1985 and January 16, 1986. There have been no sightings since that time.

Shoes: Blue, Running shoes with no laces
Tattoo: Left Hand, Tony on the 4 fingers
Left Arm, A flower with 4 petals

Case reference: 2014002240.CaseDesc: On October 17, 1993, Marcus Laing was reported missing when he failed to show up for work which was out of character for him.

Case reference: 2021039122.CaseDesc: In June 1961, Robert Heard was seen for the last time walking in the forest near his farm located on Pot Hole Road in Eby Township, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Robert was experiencing a decline in his mental capacity.

Case reference: 2014003840.CaseDesc: On December 7, 1986, a male was seen floating in the river. The male initially responded to police calls however shortly after he was observed going under the water. It is presumed he drowned. The identity of the male was unknown to police until Roderick Cook's parents contacted police advising they had not seen their son for some time. It is assumed the man in the river was Roderick based both on the description and the fact that he was seen walking near the river. Police further found footprints that led from the shore to the open water. No foul play is suspected in this matter and it is assumed Roderick drowned.

Teeth: Two front upper teeth are false

Case reference: 2014004353.CaseDesc: On June 23, 2002 RCMP received a call reporting a missing person in the Village of Makinak. Reported missing was George Turnbull, 82 years old. George was last seen on June 22, 2002 at approximately 8:00 pm by a home care worker and was last spoken to on the phone by his son at approximately 10:00 pm that same day. The home care worker arrived at approximately 9:00 am on June 23, 2002 and noticed at that time George was not in his residence. At approximately 10:00 am the family began to search in and around the area of George's residence and farm yard. He suffers from mild dementia and has wandered off before. Volunteers continued to search for him until June 26, 2002 at which point the search was called off. George Turnbull was not seen again.

Case reference: 2014005999.CaseDesc: On February 5, 2013, at approximately 3:00 p.m., Quincy Blackburn was seen for the last time when his sister dropped him off at the Toronto Pearson International Airport in Toronto, Ontario. Quincy boarded a flight to Trinidad and was scheduled to return on February 19, but did not board the flight.

Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Earrings, Square diamond earrings
Pants: Red, White, TRACK, Track pants; Brand: Adidas

Case reference: 2021002686.CaseDesc: On January 12, 2021, shortly after 5:00 pm, Brock Curtis was last seen at the Prospect Point in Niagara Falls State Park, New York. Several witnesses observed Brock jumping into the falls, and being swept away.

Case reference: 2014029389.CaseDesc: Jed Ouillette was last seen on the afternoon of September 8, 2014. Personal identification items were left behind at his residence. Mr. Ouillette had lost his driver's license due to medical issues involving seizures and was in financial difficulty.

Case reference: 2014006627.CaseDesc: On November 9, 2012, Andria Meise was reported missing from Kelowna, British Columbia. Andria was last seen in Grande Prairie, Alberta between July 2010 and September 2010. Andria was known to be living a high risk lifestyle and traveled between Grande Prairie, Dawson Creek, Fort St. John, Kelowna and Vancouver.

Case reference: 2014002821.CaseDesc: During the weekend of August 18, 1972, Dennis Simpson and a friend left for a fishing trip on McMillian Lake. When they failed to return by the 22nd, numerous people contacted police. Through investigation it was later determined that both men were last seen by a man on shore on Sunday the 20th, and their camp was still set up. They told the individual that they were going to make one more pass and then intended to break camp. Weather conditions at the time were such that there would have been rough water. Given this and the fact that the men were in a fairly small canoe, it was determined they may have capsized. An extensive land, water and air search did not find anything other than various articles that were identified as belonging to the two missing fishermen. Mr. Simpson has never been located.

Case reference: 2015011636.CaseDesc: On June 20, 1998, a fisherman saw the body of a man floating in the St. Lawrence River in front of L'île aux Vaches.

Socks: White, Grey, white top and gray on bottom
Tattoo: Right Shoulder, sword and a cross

Case reference: 2013000090.CaseDesc: On June 16, 1983, Nicola Michel Tola was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. He was suppose to come home and make dinner but he was never seen again by his family. His car was located at the Pie IX shopping mall.

Case reference: 2020009613.CaseDesc: On March 6, 1989, Marcelo Onorato was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Marcelo was visiting from Argentina and was due to return there on March 12, but he never boarded his flight.

Case reference: 2022060312.CaseDesc: On October 28, 2022, Bradley McGilvery was seen for the last time at a family residence in Saddle Lake,  St. Paul, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014002220.CaseDesc: Melvin Hoel was last seen on May 12, 1997 in the Cataract Creek Provincial Recreation Area, Alberta, where his vehicle and all his belongings were found by Fish and Wildlife agents.

Case reference: 2018023712.CaseDesc: On May 1, 2018, Elsa Vargas was last seen near her home in Chateauguay, Quebec. Ms. Vargas also has citizenship in Costa Rica.

Mark: Right Cheek, Mole on the right side

Case reference: 2006002199.CaseDesc: On September 23, 1994, this Caucasian male, was found in a field on the south side of the Rogers Centre (formerly known as the SkyDome) at the far end of Rees Street in Toronto. His post-mortem length was approximately 6’2" and he weighed 162lbs, however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Teeth: Missing several teeth; had a great deal of restorative work done in the past with multiple silver-amalgam restorations

Case reference: 2024028148.CaseDesc: Robert “Bob” Austin was on the phone with family members, on June 4, 2024.  During the phone call he advised them that he was at his home in Baysville, Ontario.  His family reported him missing on June 5, 2024, after they attended his residence and he wasn’t there.

Case reference: 2012020143.CaseDesc: On October 23, 1996, Lucie Bouchard was last seen driving her 1994 purple Honda Civic. She dropped her sister near Cremazie East and Saint-Michel Boulevard in Montreal, Quebec around 9:45 p.m. After that, she was expected to return home to Brossard on Montreal's south shore, but she never arrived. Lucie suffers from epilepsy and requires medication. She may have, on average, 2 to 3 epileptic seizures per month.

Case reference: 2006016699.CaseDesc: Michael Gadke and Morris Werenko were last seen in around Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario, and were last heard from as they were circling over Goulais Bay in a Cessna C-172 aircraft. The Cessna C-172, had white wings with red tips, a red fuselage with white stripe and white underside. Top of engine cowling was red.

Case reference: 2014002519.CaseDesc: Denis Beauchamp was last seen on April 18, 1977 in Montreal. Denis went to his sister's house after an argument with his boyfriend. He stayed there for a few days, and then left without giving any more news.

Case reference: 2012020109.CaseDesc: David Fortin was last seen while waiting for the school bus on the morning of February 10, 2009, in Alma, Québec. He was to take the school bus at approximately 7:50 am to get to the Camille Lavoie High School in Alma. However, he never got onto the bus and did not report to school. According to his family, David was a victim of bullying and intimidation at school for several years.

Case reference: 2002005560.CaseDesc: On July 2, 1975, at approximately 8:30 p.m., Michelle Wedge returned to her residence, but left shortly afterwards. Her bicycle was later located at the intersection of John and Dominion Street, which was not far from her residence in Moncton, New Brunswick.

Case reference: 2014005105.CaseDesc: On May 11, 2001, at approximately 8:00 p.m., Younes Taleb was seen for the last time at his mother’s business in Toronto, Ontario.

Mark: Cheek, Mole on the right cheek

Case reference: 2022034269.CaseDesc: On June 17, 2022, Malcolm Custer was last seen in the Big Sandy Bay Fishing and Hunting Resort area near Big Sandy Lake, Saskatchewan. Malcolm visits the settlements of La Ronge, Descambault Lake, Brabant Lake, Stanley Mission, and the City of Prince Albert; although he does not have a fixed address.

Case reference: 2014002257.CaseDesc: James Clarke was last seen in Kemptville, Ontario on May 10, 1975. At the age of sixteen, James left his mother’s home, and his family have not heard from him since.

Case reference: 2014005677.CaseDesc: On September 21, 2011, John Fadden was last seen in the University Endowment Lands, British Columbia.  He also suffered from dementia.

Case reference: 2021015656.CaseDesc: On October 22, 2017, Ann Victor-Lazarus was seen for the last time as she left her home to go to church. Ann’s vehicle was found in a parking lot near the “Parking Authority Water Intakes” on the Niagara River Parkway in Niagara Falls, New York State. Her personal belongings, as well as a note, were found in her vehicle. Ann was captured on video surveillance near the railing of the waterway.

Case reference: 2016050062.CaseDesc: On August 31, 2016, Jami Springer was last seen in Moncton, New Brunswick.  Since then, no one has heard or seen Jami, and the police consider her disappearance as suspicious.

Case reference: 2012020179.CaseDesc: This adult Caucasian female was recovered from a freight yard north of 127 Water Street. in Vancouver.

Case reference: 2018067897.CaseDesc: Robert Lambert, an American citizen who moved to Canada in 2004, was reported missing on November 30th, 2018 in Montague Township in Ontario.  Robert experienced mobility issues and signs of dementia and foul play cannot be ruled out at this time.

Case reference: 2020008364.CaseDesc: On December 19, 1982, at approximately 10:30 am, Simon Yefronovich was seen for the last time by his friend as he left his residence in Toronto, Ontario. Simon was scheduled to fly to Vancouver, British Columbia, with his friend, but he never boarded the flight.

Case reference: 2014003900.CaseDesc: On December 8, 1977 at approximately 3 p.m., Ronald Foucault left his father’s business located in the city of Blainville, Quebec and told his father he had to travel to Texas, in the United States for work. There has been no news from Ronald since this time and it is impossible to confirm his arrival in the United States. In 1979, some of his belongings were found near the Dorval airport in Montreal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014004619.CaseDesc: William "Billy Jay" Sharphead was last seen leaving his residence on the Enoch Cree Nation in Alberta, in September of 2003.  On that night it is believed that he got into a car.  He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2016060952.CaseDesc: On October 2, 2016, Gaétan Roy was seen for the last time at his residence in Quebec City, Quebec. He left with a considerable amount of his personal effects and without saying where he was going. His credit cards were last used on October 6, 2016, in the Calgary, Alberta area. Gaétan is known to be despondent and he is familiar with western Canada and National Parks.

Mark: Left Forearm, Burn on the lower part
Right Forearm, Burn on the lower part

Case reference: 2005004699.CaseDesc: On September 3, 1995, an unidentified woman was found in the Niagara River, near the Maid of the Mist Dock. She had adenomyosis, similar to endometriosis. She had peach/pink polish on finger and toe nails. She is estimated to have been in the water for a few days.

Teeth: Good condition with a few white fillings. Both lower first molars were extracted before death.
Jeans: Denim, Blue, Levi's Strauss, size 27 waist and 22 inseam
Jewelry: Gold, Gold, wearing a 14" chain with crucifix; European 9K gold; manufacturing mark of "ATS"
Scar: Abdomen, 12 cm surgical scar below the naval

Case reference: 2023041781.CaseDesc: On or about March 21, 2018 Daniel Chambers was last seen in the area of Niagara Falls, New York, USA. At the time of his disappearance, Daniel was despondent.

Case reference: 2006011699.CaseDesc: Justin Pollari is from St. Joseph Island, Ontario, and was last seen on Friday, December 7, 2001. He is known to be an avid skateboarder and may frequent areas where this sport is practised.

Hair: Blonde, Sometimes worn in a "Mohawk" style
Jewelry: Wood, Nametag with the inscription of "Woody"

Case reference: 2017048277.CaseDesc: On August 20, 2017 at 11:00 pm, Christina Cooper was last seen leaving her boyfriend's residence in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012020067.CaseDesc: Bonnie Polwarth went missing from Brandon, Manitoba, on March 15, 1995. She had been undergoing counselling at the Brandon Mental Health Centre at the time of her disappearance. She is thought to have walked out of the facility on her own the day she went missing. She was supposed to be at work at 2:00 p.m. that day, but she did not show up and has been missing ever since.  Bonnie may have a forearm tattoo.

Jacket: Cream, Ivory, With green and brown

Case reference: 2014001312.CaseDesc: John McAllister was last seen leaving his home on May 7, 1973. The truck belonging to John was later found near Lodgepole, Alberta.

Case reference: 2006013699.CaseDesc: Emile Morissette was last seen while on a fishing trip at Birch Lake in Timmins Township, Ontario on July 6, 1976.

Case reference: 2006017999.CaseDesc: Agnes Battersby was visiting a friend in Barrie, Ontario; who then drove her home around 1:30 a.m. on July 28, 1968. She was unable to walk very far due to her disability. She has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2006010099.CaseDesc: David Stevens was last seen June 14, 1979, in a canoe on the Ogoki River, approximately 70 km north of Armstrong. He was believed to be going towards Whitewater Lake. An extensive search failed to locate Mr. Stevens.

Case reference: 2012020142.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2008, Shannon Alexander, 17 and Maisy Odjick, 16, were reported missing from the First Nation community of Kitigan Zibi in Quebec. This community is located near the town of Maniwaki. On September 5, 2008, the two girls went to the Maniwaki arena, where several young people were present. Maisy then went to spend the night at Shannon’s house. Shannon’s father was the last person to have seen his daughter on September 6, 2008. In 2015 an age progression was done for both Maisy and Shannon.

Pierce: Mouth, 2 loops on the lower lip

Case reference: 2014011272.CaseDesc: During the morning of June 10, 2014, Yvonne Wallace left her residence in Niagara Falls, Ontario. She has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2012020082.CaseDesc: Katelyn Noble was last seen in the Radisson, SK district in mid August, 2007. Katelyn has had no contact with her family or friends in Mission, BC, and her whereabouts are unknown.

Case reference: 2014005582.CaseDesc: Lionel Joseph Daigle went missing from the New Direction Special Care home, located on the Westside of the City of Saint John. Mr. Daigle was last seen April 3, 2011. He is reported to have mental health issues and requires regular medication. The public is urged to contact the Saint John Police Force with any information concerning his whereabouts.

Jacket: Grey, Winter jacket, 3/4 length with hood

Case reference: 2015011647.CaseDesc: On June 13, 1994, the body of a woman was found floating in the St. Lawrence River at St-Jean Baptiste Street in the Pointe aux Trembles area of Montreal. She took good care of her teeth and according to experts the body would have been in the water for about 4 months.

Shoes: Leather, Brown, Black, black pattern on the side and orthopedic supports in acrylic brown and red in both shoes
Scar: Chest, right and left breast surgery
Chest, has possibly undergone a partial ablation

Case reference: 2006011499.CaseDesc: Gordon Berg was a passenger in a boat, fishing on Sturgeon Lake about 125 km west of Armstrong, Ontario, on October 10, 1969. The boat capsized in rough water, and the occupants were thrown into the lake. He was last seen as he drifted away from the boat. He is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2014004957.CaseDesc: On New Year's Eve, 2002 an anonymous letter was received by the Vancouver Police Department. The letter referred to a female Vancouver sex trade worker who had disappeared one month earlier, at the end of November. The letter writer described the woman, admitted to killing her, and apologized to her family for taking her life. Investigators believe the letter writer was referring to Danielle Marissa Larue, and while her body has never been found, they believe that she was murdered. The letter writer knows what happened to Danielle, and police are hopeful that the writer will contact them again.

Case reference: 2020043711.CaseDesc: Alfred L'Arrivee was last seen on May 3, 1973 at a rural property where he resided in Keg River, Alberta. Alfred has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2012020027.CaseDesc: Maggie Lea Burke was last seen on December 9, 2004 in Edmonton, Alberta. She left her residence in the area of 118 avenue and 95 street, to go meet a friend and has not been seen since.

Hair: Brown, dyed pink purple and blond streaks at tips
Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Black, nose stud
Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, necklace with charm
Black, Remand Centre cross on a black string

Case reference: 2006026699.CaseDesc: On May 22, 1967, at about 10:30 a.m. Mr. Sauder was fishing with friends in Bouillon Lake, Calvin Township, District of Nipissing, in a twelve foot aluminum boat. He stood up and the boat capsized. Mr. Sauder could not swim and was not wearing a life jacket.

Case reference: 2012020167.CaseDesc: This adult male was recovered from Burrard Inlet. He was previously discovered as a stowaway on the vessel S.K. Junior that originated in Ningbo, China on March 15th, 1997 and arrived in Vancouver April 4th, 1997.

Teeth: Stained, Poor oral hygiene and forensic analysis identified many unique characteristics in his dentition.
Jacket: Synthetic, Blue, Red, blue and white track suit jacket with stripes down the sleeves

Case reference: 2006008599.CaseDesc: Adrien McNaughton wandered off into a wooded area of Holmes Lake, Brougham Township, on June 12, 1972.

Scar: Forehead, approximately 1 - 2 inches long, and possibly over the left eye.

Case reference: 2006012799.CaseDesc: John Crofts last resided in a retirement home on Yearly Road in Huntsville. He was last seen in the Huntsville area on December 25, 1997.

Case reference: 2014005520.CaseDesc: On November 20, 2010, at approximately 5:00 p.m., Dina Bat-Og was seen for the last time leaving her home to go to work in Toronto, Ontario. Dina had advised that she would be returning home at midnight, but never returned.

Case reference: 2015033938.CaseDesc: On the morning of June 27, 2015, Curtis Wilson was seen for the last time by a friend in Kelowna, British Columbia. Curtis had travelled from Alberta to British Columbia in a black rental car, model Chrysler 200. Subsequently, the rental was recovered in an area off Cosen Bay in the Kalamakla Provincial Park in Coldstream, British Columbia.

Shirt: Black, TSHIRT, Orange logo on front of shirt
Tattoo: Right Forearm, Skull in top hat 'Wicked'; skull outer forearm
Right Forearm, Skull with snake through it, $$ signs & flaming skull
Left Chest, Eagle head; upper chest
Left Forearm, Red & black scorpion on inside forearm
Right Upper Arm, Three skulls, inside bicep
Right Upper Arm, Skull, outside bicep

Case reference: 2014001191.CaseDesc: On April 22, 2010, the body of an unidentified man was found in the Richelieu River in Saint-Mathias-sur-Richelieu, Quebec. In his possession were a Hipstreet brand MP3 player and headphones. The images shown are facial approximation portraits of this unidentified man created by the Sûreté du Québec.

Case reference: 2014003688.CaseDesc: On September 23, 1981, William Earnshaw was hunting in the Clemenceau District, Saskatchewan, southwest of Hudson Bay, Saskatchewan. He had separated from two companions and failed to meet at their vehicle in the evening. An extensive search of the area has failed to locate William.

Case reference: 2014004565.CaseDesc: On December 1, 2004, Jack Day left Fort McMurray, Alberta, for an unknown destination. On December 4, 2004, Mr. Day's abandoned vehicle was discovered at Chrystina Lake Provincial Recreational area near Swan Hills, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014002572.CaseDesc: André Demange was last seen on September 2, 1983, in Montreal, Quebec. André's personal effects were found a few days later near the water close to Des Ormeaux and Bellerive street.

Case reference: 2016010572.CaseDesc: Richard Jones was last seen at his family’s residence in Brantford in late fall of 1975 and has not been seen since. Mr. Jones was also enrolled in the Graphic Design course at Sheridan College’s Oakville Campus in September of 1975.

Case reference: 2009002699.CaseDesc: Norman Welsh was on holidays with his mother and an incident occurred on July 18, 1976, which subsequently led him to the hospital. While in the hospital he was described as bitter and un-cooperative wanting to return home in St Catharines. While being escorted to the North Bay Pyschiatric Hospital (now Northeast Mental Health Centre), he ran off into the wooded area.

Teeth: Stained, Has a 2 tooth partial plate and is missing his front upper left tooth, teeth slightly stained
Scar: Head, Under the hair, due to an operation at the age of 16

Case reference: 2023030253.CaseDesc: Autumn Shaganash was last seen on June 10, 2023.  She has had no activity on her bank account, no money on her person, and no cellphone. Autumn, according to her immediate family, suffers from depression and anxiety and must take prescribed medication on a daily basis. She hasn't taken her medication since.

Case reference: 2006000199.CaseDesc: October 26, 1986, an unidentified man was found under the ramp to the Gardiner Expressway and Spadina Avenue behind 252 Queens Quay West, in Toronto, Ontario. He was well-nourished, and was found not wearing any clothing.

Hair: Grey, White, Short, Male pattern baldness, 4mm facial stubble
Mark: Left Elbow, Small mole on the side of his left elbow

Case reference: 2018041855.CaseDesc: On December 8, 1992, Grayce Baxter was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. She was a known transgendered sex trade worker. She had a transaction with Patrick Johnson who subsequently confessed to her homicide. Grayce’s remains were never recovered.

Coat: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Fur, Full length coat

Case reference: 2020011626.CaseDesc: On September 18, 1989, Ioan Sandea was seen for the last time leaving his residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006013299.CaseDesc: Thomas Hesse was last seen on September 2, 1989 in Moonbeam Township, near Cochrane, Ontario.  He was riding a Raleigh, 3-speed, gold coloured, lady's bicycle.  Mr. Hesse left his parents' house in a depressed state and may have been suicidal.

Case reference: 2014005583.CaseDesc: Mary Mark was a resident of east Vancouver in the 1970's. She did not apply for any government-issued identification or obtain social assistance, so information is very sparse on Mrs. Mark's life after 1975. It is believed that she met with foul play as the result of domestic violence. Her body was never recovered and the suspect is now deceased.

Case reference: 2015049499.CaseDesc: Loretta Garrett's husband and friends reported her missing on July 19, 1961. They were on a fishing trip near the mouth of the Moose Brook River in Northesk Parish, New Brunswick. The four of them shared a car and parked near the trailhead. The men hiked across a trail until they reached the water to fish. The women remained in the car. Shortly after, Loretta complained about the heat and bugs and started down the same trail as the men, but she was never seen again.

Case reference: 2006018599.CaseDesc: Richard Rees and Gregory Cook were last seen on July 17, 1998, leaving Sunnyside Beach, Nottawasaga Bay in Meaford, Ontario in a Schwill DS16 sailboat. The overturned sailboat was recovered, but Richard and Gregory have not been located.

Mark: Upper Back, pale birthmark on right side

Case reference: 2014004320.CaseDesc: On February 22, 2002, Alexandre Fortin was seen for the last time in a home situated on road 127 in Saint-Georges, Quebec. Over the course of the night, a fire completely destroyed the residence and Alexandre remains missing, despite search operations.

Case reference: 2024016887.CaseDesc: Maggie JACKNIFE was last seen in Rocky Rapids, Alberta around October, 1960.

Case reference: 2012020646.CaseDesc: Antonie Medzech was last seen outside the Midtown Plaza in downtown Saskatoon, Saskatchewan at approximately 8:00 a.m. on December 13, 2002. Antonie had been dropped off at that location to go shopping.

Jewelry: Leather, Watch, silver face, black strap

Case reference: 2017027475.CaseDesc: On May 14, 2017, Roman Mussabekov was seen for the last time when he boarded a flight at the Montreal-Pierre-Elliott-Trudeau International Airport in Montreal, Quebec. He checked-in at a hotel on the island of Antigua in the Caribbean, but did not check-out. Roman contacted his mother a few days after his arrival to tell her that he was going on a hike in the mountains. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Hair: Brown, Short, Straight, Short on the sides, longer on top

Case reference: 2014003631.CaseDesc: Xiu Zi Lin was last seen on February 3, 1998 in Montreal. Ms. Lin came from China with no documentation or family. She was placed in a shelter. She left the center without giving a new address.

Case reference: 2014002002.CaseDesc: On September 17, 1977, Gaetan Pichette was seen for the last time in the Verdun district of Montreal, Quebec. His family and friends have not seen or heard from him since.

Tattoo: Right Arm, Arm tattoo, inscribed with "COCU"

Case reference: 2021008992.CaseDesc: On March 7, 2021, Konstantin Boukhanov travelled to Toronto, Ontario without telling his family. Konstantin has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014001572.CaseDesc: On July 19, 1970, Arthur Stephens left his home in Gimli, Manitoba. He had planned to go fishing in the Whiteshell Provincial Park. Arthur told his wife that he would return on July 21, 1970. He further advised her that if he was going to stay any longer, he would call her to let her know. By July 22, 1970, Arthur had not returned home and his wife hadn't received a phone call. She reported him missing to police that day. On August 1, 1970, Arthur's vehicle was located near Falcon Beach.  Extensive ground, lake and air searches were done of the area. All efforts to locate him failed to uncover any further leads. Arthur Stephens whereabouts remain unknown.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm, Circular tattoo (exact design/pattern unknown)

Case reference: 1989125890.CaseDesc: Jeffrey was taken by a couple driving a 1979-80 blue chevy truck.

Shirt: Beige, Brown, T-SHIRT, Long sleeve - brown trim

Case reference: 2014001617.CaseDesc: On January 25, 1976, Camille Lessard was last seen in Montreal, Quebec. He regularly went to the tavern located on the corner of Papineau and Sainte-Catherine East in Le Village district of Montreal, Quebec. Camille suffers from memory loss.

Case reference: 2023001420.CaseDesc: On November 7, 2022, Sohail Shahid was seen for the last time at Terrapin Point, American Falls, Niagara Falls, New York. Witnesses observed Sohail jumping over the railing. At the time of his disappearance, Sohail was despondent.

Case reference: 2014006024.CaseDesc: On March 10, 2013, Richard Bailey was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. He was reported missing by his wife the next day when he failed to return home from work.

Case reference: 2010004199.CaseDesc: Kalon Purvis had been living and working in the Minden area since early May 2008.  He had been involved in a car accident on June 19, 2008 resulting in him needing to use a rental car.  The small red rental car was returned sometime in July.  Mr. Purvis was last seen in July 2008 when he was dropped off in the area of the Home Hardware store in Minden to meet someone he was going to do some work for, for two weeks.  Mr. Purvis would have had a large male dog (Rottweiler) named Magnum with him around the time of his disappearance.

Hair: Black, Wavy, Medium length and parted in the middle
Tattoo: Abdomen, Incomplete graphic of horse heads

Case reference: 2014003295.CaseDesc: Wayne Ronald Baker was reported missing on June 8, 1989 after not reporting to his shift at Phil's Restaurant in Banff, Alberta.  He was last seen by his roommate in staff accommodation the evening of June 7. Wayne Baker may have been seen in Edmonton at the Crest Hotel in July 1989.

Case reference: 2013000144.CaseDesc: Robert Angelo Furgiuele from Sault Ste-Marie, Ontario was last seen in Squamish, British-Columbia in 1991. He was residing in Squamish with his girlfriend and his daughter. He was working in a grocery store at the time. He last spoke to his mother by telephone in 1991. He might have moved to Vancouver Island, British-Columbia in 1992.

Case reference: 2012020044.CaseDesc: On December 23, 1986, Rodney Sloat was seen for the last time, by his friends, in Strathcona County, Alberta. That evening, Rodney was having dinner at his friends’ residence, and had left on his snowmobile at approximately midnight. During the time of his disappearance, Rodney may have been despondent. All of his personal belongings, identification, and snowmobile were found at his residence.

Case reference: 2006009699.CaseDesc: Dwayne Lee left his residence on December 24th,1999. His vehicle was located December 26, 1999, at Gray's Beach, Thousand Island's Parkway in the Township of Leeds and Thousand Islands.

Case reference: 2005004599.CaseDesc: On August 22, 1996, an unidentified man, believed to be Caucasian was recovered from the Sir Adam Beck Dam in the Niagara River. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 145 lbs and his length was measured at 5'10" to 5’11”, however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He has evidence of heart disease and may have had heart problems in the past. It is estimated that he had been in the water for a few days up to two weeks prior to discovery. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts that this unidentified male is of European ancestry.

Hair: Brown, Grey, Long, Long grey and white beard 12cm
Teeth: No upper teeth and no lower posterior teeth; remaining teeth have roots only; crowns are lost due to decay.

Case reference: 2018010790.CaseDesc: In December of 2017, Willard Duval was seen last in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Willard had not been seen or heard from in two months.
